Detailed Description

This class writes a DAT file. The pixel DataSet data is written using Windows memory-mapping

Member Function Documentation

bool MMDATFileWriter::Close ( void   ) 

Closes the writer. This writes the pixel data to the file in network order and closes the file. Once the writer is closed it should not be used to open and read the pixel data, overwritting existing pixel data is OK.

Returns:
true if it succeeded. Method may also throw exceptions.

int32_t MMDATFileWriter::GetPixelRowsMapped (  ) 

Get the number of DAT image rows that have been mapped. The number of pixels mapped is the number of row mapped times the number of pixels per row (DATData::GetCols).

Returns:
The number of DAT image rows mapped for access.

Definition at line 142 of file MMDATFileWriter.cpp.

References affymetrix_calvin_io::MMDataSetDataWriter::GetRowsMapped().

void MMDATFileWriter::MapPixelData ( int32_t  firstRow,
int32_t  rowsToMap 
)

Maps the pixel data for access starting at firstRow and continuing for rowsToMap. The number of pixels mapped is the number of row mapped times the number of pixels per row (DATData::GetCols).

Parameters:
firstRow First row of the DAT image to map for access.
rowsToMap Requested number of DAT image rows to map. Use GetRowsMapped for number of rows actually mapped.

Definition at line 107 of file MMDATFileWriter.cpp.

References affymetrix_calvin_io::MMDataSetDataWriter::MapData().

bool MMDATFileWriter::Open (  ) 

Opens the writer. This opens the file and a memory-mapped view of the pixel DataSet. It closes a previously opened file.

Returns:
true if it succeeded. Method may also throw exceptions.
Exceptions:
affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::FileCreateException
